[h1]"Why ask what, when the delicious question is when?"[/h1]
When will you fully grasp the concepts behind every twist and turn in this game? I loved Bioshock 1 for it's story, 2 for it's gameplay, and now Infinite for the story telling. As you play the game there are minimal hints and clues that tie the ending. They may seem unimportant, but they end up blowing your mind. It's a unique experience compared to the first two games, in the beginning the game felt unrelated. But in the end you realize [b]"There's always a lighthouse. There's always a man. There's always a city."[/b]

Checkpoint saves are an automatic thumbs down for me. I can't always play until the next "checkpoint", and that may cause me to lose as much as 30 minutes of game progress. No thanks. I really don't understand why games - especially story focused games like this - use a checkpoint save system.

In the 1.6 hours I played, I thought the world, the graphics, the audio were very good and there was enough story to keep it interesting, but without going into a lot of detail in order to avoid sending the woke running for their coloring books and safe spaces, this game is over the top woke. Even if the game didn't have checkpoint saves, I'd give the game a thumbs down for the silly woke premise of the story. Early in the game, a character actually says, "I'm not like them (read evil, non-woke), I'm progressive (read good, woke)". Too shallow for me. If you're going to there go deeper, don't give me silly CNN sound bite stuff.

I'd ask for a refund but I bought the game ages ago on sale, and I'm sure even though I'm less than 2 hours in, my refund request would be rejected because I've owned the game too long. So buyer beware. If don't like checkpoint saves or over the top "wokeism" you should avoid this game. If you enjoy both of those things or don't care about them either way, then you will probably be like the other 90%+ of people who played this game and enjoyed it.
My nose was bleeding like Booker trying to understand this plot. One of the all time classics.

8/10 This game graphics is beautiful. Soundtrack the good ol' 1900s. And gunplay was so good and each gun is fun to use. The story on the other hand was if you think of it as standalone then it was alright, interesting enough but if you look at it as part of the entire BioShock trilogy then it's bad. And the reason why is because the story is simply vastly different than what original Bioshock 1 & 2 was about. But you do get a pretty waifu companion so win win? Overall I think this game is good and worth the buy but I'd recommend waiting for the sale discount.
YO BOYS GOOD STORY Highly Recommended

Mam wrazenie jakbym gral w jakas produkcje docelowo zaprojektowana pod smarfona. Koszmar. Przereklamowane badziewie, ktore trzyma tylko i wylacznie narraca, opowiadana historia (a i tak zalosnie splycona). Nie, nie i jeszcze raz nie.
Juego corto, pero una de las mejores historias a las que he jugado

This game gives me a lot of feeling, tears of joy, thrilling, amazement and many others. I wonder if there are any kind of video games that could tell us the story marvellously, giving us touching feeling as much as Bioshocks did. Of course there would be but only few ones I guess ;)

At first the game started wonderfully, but then the COD influence became apparent as the gun play was simplified to the point of embarrassment and the story line simply liked the smell of its own farts too much after the midway point. Bioshock 1 and 2 are on a different league compared to this one. Nonetheless, I had fun 60-70% of the time, some of the characters are interesting, and the graphics are beautiful too look at.

The perfect ending to the BioShock franchise. The opening section of the main game and DLC is breathtaking and immersive on a level like I'd never seen in a game before. They really know how to write a game to suck you right in. Games like this are a true rarity.

Very well curated gaming experience with one the most coherent game worlds I 've had the pleasure to dabble in. Art, sound, music, story, and gameplay are seemlessly integrated and the team behind this just made all the right choices. Immersive AF. You should get it.
Still as good as I remember it.

An honest review of this game is a 7/10. The player is unable to understand the story through 95% of the game and then in the last 5% it tries to close it out, but most players end up having to watch youtube videos in order to piece it all together. There isnt a 'set' way to interpret the story though - and the youtubers have different theories on how the story ACTUALLY happens "my favorite is the infinite loop theory". Overall the game is too short as well. Gameplay is good. There is zero character development until the end of the game which throws massive turns at you... but by then the game is already over.

story wise, if you have ever seen the movie Inception - thats what this game is all about, but just poorly executed and without Leo. #sadface#

This game has no classic save system. It saves at predefined points that are far apart. This means that you cannot quit the game when you want without having to replay a large part of the game next time...
Very annoying for gamers that like to move slowly through a game like me.  Also annoying when you like to play in short sessions. This "feature" should have been an option and should not be forced on me.  Now it feels like the developers are bullying me as they know better how I like to game...
got my bio shocked to infinity 10/10

Fun.. but $15 for 1-1.5 hours of gameplay? Please. Seems asinine to pay $30 for two DLCs that are 3-4 hrs combined when the main game regularly goes for $7-15 on sales. Watch the DLCs on Youtube, buy the main game.

This barely feels like a Bioshock game. There are no options, no consequences, no exploration and the story feels like they wrote it on the go.
